channel.title: Easy on my Blog site
channel.description: Recent content in Easy on my Blog site

item.title: Crafty
item.description: machine IP : 10.10.11.249 startign with the nmap scan let’s do another namp scan with all ports to see if we can get any info we’ve found that 25565 port is open let’s focus on gathering more info add the ip to /etc/hosts to access the ip the above result is the result of wappalyzer extension for the website let’s explore the website website dashboard every option we click is being redirected to comming soon webpage we’ve have dound another subdomain play.

item.title: Keeper
item.description: Starting with a nmap scan we have this result When we access the IP address on port 80 via a browser, we can see there is just one link which redirects to tickets.keeper.htb/rt. But in order to do that we need to add this IP to our /etc/hosts file 10.129.122.221 tickets.keeper.htb 10.129.122.221 keeper.htb i’ve ried some default passweords and dource code but it wasn’t helpful i’ve googled and searched in exploit db but found no exploit mentioned in the web page so i searched for default creds for Request tracker

item.title: Perfection
item.description: Startign with nmap the website dashboard checked the wappalyzer to find the technologies website is using but couldn’t find any I tried directory fuzzing Found this at the bottom of the website we got another info that susan is sysadmin we can see this in the about us and there might me a vulnerability on secure coding there is a input field in the website , there might be a input validation vulnerbility

item.title: Academy
item.description: Starting with Nmap we won’t be able to connect to the website using only ip address so we can access the website after adiing the website in /etc/hosts The POST request to register a new user is interesting: While the uid (user id) and double password fields are expected, roleid is interesting. I’ll register again, but this time I’ll use Burp proxy to intercept the POST and change roleid to 1.
